alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is occurring in the Miami Springs and Hialeah areas. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in these locations. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Medley, Gladeview, Miami International Airport, West Little River, Westview and Virginia Gardens. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
